Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2011 05:28PM DAC wrote: vicmjones, I recommend the biopsy for peace of mind hopefully but in the event that there is something sinister there (hopefully not) the sooner you treat it the better.  This is coming from someone who's mammograms were good until late last year when it turned bad and had very intense lymph node involvement which meant membership to chemo club which is not fun.  Biopsies are unpleasant but soon forgotten.  Best of luck.
Posts.Title: Do I really need a biopsy? vicmjones jadeblue
